title: How to Make Slow Cooker Pork Chops

steps.headline: Spray a nonstick skillet with nonstick cooking spray.
Remove pork chops from package and add to hot skillet.
Brown pork chops on both sides.
steps.description: They do not need to be fully cooked just browned.

steps.headline: Spray a slow cooker container with nonstick cooking spray.
Season with salt and pepper.
steps.description: Go easy on the salt as the bouillon granules will add plenty of salt to the dish.

steps.headline: Season with a bit of garlic and onion powders.
Stir soup and add to pork chops in slow cooker vessel.
Add half soup can of water.
Cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or until the pork chops are tender.

text: Spray a nonstick skillet with nonstick cooking spray.  Heat skillet over medium-high heat.  Remove pork chops from package and add to hot skillet.  Brown pork chops on both sides. They do not need to be fully cooked just browned. Spray a slow cooker container with nonstick cooking spray.  Add browned pork chops.  Season with salt and pepper. Go easy on the salt as the bouillon granules will add plenty of salt to the dish. Season with a bit of garlic and onion powders.  Stir soup and add to pork chops in slow cooker vessel.  Add chicken broth granules.  Add half soup can of water.  Cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or until the pork chops are tender.
